description: G.f.: 1/(1-3*x*C) where C = (1/2-1/2*(1-4*x)^(1/2))/x = g.f. for Catalan numbers A000108.
comments: Chains in rooted plane trees on n nodes.The Hankel transform of the aerated sequence with g.f. 1/(1-3x^2c(x^2)) is also 3^n. In general, the expansions of 1/(1-k*x*c(x)) and 1/(1-k*x^2*c(x^2)) have Hankel transform k^n. - _Paul Barry_, Jan 20 2007Binomial transform of A112657 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 25 2007Row sums of the Riordan matrix (1/sqrt(1-4x),(1-sqrt(1-4x))/(2*sqrt(1-4x))) (A116395) [_Emanuele Munarini_, Apr 26 2011]
references: M. Klazar, Twelve countings with rooted plane trees, European Journal of Combinatorics 18 (1997), 195-210; Addendum, 18 (1997), 739-740.

formula: a(n) = (9*a(n-1)-3*A000108(n-2))/2 = 3*A049027(n-1) = A067336(n-1)*3/2 = A049027(n-1)+A067336(n-1) = A067347(3, n-1). - _Henry Bottomley_, Jan 16 2002a(n) = Sum_{k>=0} A106566(n, k)*3^k. - _Philippe Deléham_, Aug 11 2005The Hankel transform of this sequence is A000244 = [1, 3, 9, 27, 81, 243, 729, ...](powers of 3). - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 26 2006a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} C(2n,n-k)(2k+1)2^k/(n+k+1). - _Paul Barry_, Jan 20 2007a(n) = Sum_{0<=k<=n} A039599(n,k)*2^k. - _Philippe Deléham_, Sep 08 2007a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} A116395(n,k). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Mar 09 2011Contribution from _Emanuele Munarini_, Apr 26 2011 (Start)a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} C(2*n-k,n-k)*(k*3^k)/(2*n-k), for n>0.a(n) = (1/4)*(9/2)^n-3*Sum_{k=0..n} C(2*k,k)/(2k-1)*(9/2)^(n-k).Recurrence: 2*(n+2)*a(n+2)-(17*n+22)*a(n+1)+18*(2*n+1)*a(n)=0.
